title: Increase penalties for the illegal taking of deer
summary: Increases penalties for the illegal taking of deer; establishes that a person who illegally takes deer more than once shall lose his or her hunting license for ten years.

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. Subdivision 1  of  section  71-0921  of  the  environmental
    2  conservation  law,  as  amended  by  chapter 289 of the laws of 2004, is
    3  amended to read as follows:
    4    1. The illegal taking of big game prior to the first day of  the  open

    6  thereof where taken, or any illegal taking of a deer, or the  taking  of

   15  VIOLATION  OF  THIS  SUBDIVISION SHALL BE PUNISHABLE BY IMPRISONMENT FOR
   16  NOT MORE THAN ONE YEAR OR BY A  FINE  OF  NOT  LESS  THAN  ONE  THOUSAND
   17  DOLLARS  NOR  MORE THAN FIVE THOUSAND DOLLARS, OR BY BOTH SUCH IMPRISON-
   18  MENT AND FINE. ADDITIONALLY, SUCH PERSON SHALL HAVE ANY EXISTING FIREARM

memo:
BILL NUMBER:S2449

TITLE OF BILL:

An act
to amend the environmental conservation law, in relation to the illegal
taking of deer

PURPOSE:

To increase the penalties for deer poaching.

SUMMARY OF PROVISIONS:

Section 1 pertains to the criminal penalties for deer poaching.
Section 2 pertains to the civil penalties for deer poaching.
Section 3 is the effective date.

JUSTIFICATION:

Too often individuals apprehended for deer poaching receive only a
slap on the wrist. This legislation would increase the criminal and
civil penalties and mandate these penalties for the first offense.

LEGISLATIVE HISTORY:

2010: S.2200/A.1534  Referred to Environmental Conservation
2009: S.2200/A.1534  Referred to Environmental Conservation
2008: S.6736/A.11477 Advanced to 3rd Reading Calendar
2007: S.859/A.735, Veto #77.
2006: S.6826-A/A.10113-A, Passed Senate and Assembly Veto #263.

FISCAL IMPLICATIONS:

None.

EFFECTIVE DATE:

One hundred twentieth day after it shall have become a law.
